How to Get Voter Data in Tennessee

November 17, 2025 tennessee voter-data voter-list voter-history

Tennessee provides access to voter registration data through the State Election Commission with a maximum cost of $2,500 for the statewide list. Unlike many states, Tennessee does not offer an online purchase option, requiring direct contact with the Division of Elections.

Quick Summary

Category Details
Statewide Cost $2,500 maximum
Voter List Access Contact Division of Elections
Voter History Access Can be requested with voter list
Delivery Method Contact SOS for delivery details
Processing Time After request and payment
Note Recommend contact before proceeding

Voter List

Tennessee provides voter registration data through the Tennessee Secretary of State - Division of Elections, but does not offer an online purchase system.

How to Access

  1. Contact the Division of Elections before proceeding:
    • Phone: 615-741-7956 or 1-877-850-4959
    • Email: tennessee.elections@tn.gov
    • Address: 312 Rosa L. Parks Avenue, Snodgrass Tower, 7th Floor, Nashville, TN 37243

  2. Inquire about current process for obtaining voter registration data

  3. Available documentation (currency uncertain):
    • State CD Purchase Information
    • This document appears to be dated and may not reflect current procedures

  4. Request voter list and any required forms/affidavits

  5. Submit payment when instructed

  6. Receive voter data via method specified by Division of Elections

What’s Included

The voter registration file includes information for registered voters in Tennessee.

Voter History

Voter history can be requested when submitting your affidavit or request for voter registration data.

How to Request

When contacting the Division of Elections:

  • Specify that you want voter history included
  • Ask about historical coverage period
  • Verify any additional costs for voter history
  • Confirm file format and structure

Cost

Tennessee charges up to $2,500 for the statewide voter registration list.

This maximum cap provides cost certainty for statewide data requests.

Important Recommendations

Recommend Contact Before Proceeding:

Tennessee’s voter data process is not well-documented online, and available documentation may be outdated. Before making any commitments:

  1. Call or email the Division of Elections
  2. Verify current process and requirements
  3. Confirm pricing for statewide data
  4. Ask about voter history availability and coverage
  5. Understand delivery methods and timeline
  6. Request current forms if applicable

Available Documentation

The most detailed available documentation is: State CD Purchase Information PDF

However:

  • This document’s currency is uncertain
  • It may not reflect current procedures
  • Process may have changed since publication
  • Contact Division of Elections for current information

Restrictions and Permitted Uses

When requesting Tennessee voter data, users must comply with state laws regarding the use of voter registration records. The Division of Elections will provide specific terms of use and legal requirements during the request process.

Technical Notes

No Online Purchase

Unlike many states, Tennessee does not offer:

  • Online purchase portal
  • Self-service data requests
  • Automated payment processing
  • Immediate downloads

The contact-based system requires direct communication with the Division of Elections.

Affidavit Requirement

Based on available documentation, Tennessee likely requires an affidavit or formal request form. Confirm current requirements when contacting the Division of Elections.

CD Delivery

Historical documentation references CD delivery, though current delivery methods may include:

  • Physical media (CD, flash drive)
  • Email/FTP transfer
  • Cloud storage links
  • Other digital delivery

Verify current delivery methods with the Division of Elections.

Voter History Details

The availability and structure of voter history should be confirmed:

  • Is it included with the base price or additional?
  • How many years/elections are covered?
  • What format is used?
  • How does it match to voter registration data?

Testing Status

This system has not been independently tested. The lack of current online documentation makes direct contact essential before proceeding.

Contact Information

Tennessee Secretary of State - Division of Elections

  • Address: 312 Rosa L. Parks Avenue, Snodgrass Tower, 7th Floor, Nashville, TN 37243
  • Phone: 615-741-7956 or 1-877-850-4959 (toll-free)
  • Email: tennessee.elections@tn.gov
  • Website: https://sos.tn.gov/elections

Recommended: Contact via phone or email before proceeding to verify current processes and requirements.

Tennessee’s voter data system with a $2,500 maximum cost provides reasonable pricing for statewide data, but the lack of current online documentation and absence of an online purchase option makes direct contact with the Division of Elections essential. Call or email before proceeding to verify the current process, requirements, pricing, and voter history availability.
